reviews.text: It's a decent park, you will find Gardner snakes, marmots, deers, mosquitoes, we noticed glob of bear poop, some wild hemp or cannabis is growing in the park that I find strange. The cliff where the children play off of I find very dangerous and should be fenced since it's right beside and above the swing and slides. It's a. good 25ft or more drop. Not very child safe at all. Btw cougars have been spotted time to to there. The dock is amazing and looks good to fish on. Washrooms are well... public.

My best friend and his amazing wife had their wedding ceremony here. Absolutely beautiful location. Everything turned out perfectly and no deer interrupted the ceremony. The hecklers I had hired for the wedding decided not to show up as it was quite a drive.

Well maintained park and typically only attracts locals so it's not super busy either.  Playground, picnic area, public washrooms, large field, pavillion, trails and beach areas. Something to note though is that dogs, even on leash, are not allowed in this park.

What’s not to love? Rocky “beach” but plenty of grass to set up for the day on. Kids had a blast in the waist- chest deep water (they are 6&7), nice long pier to walk out on, and QUIET!!! We were there from 930-330 and maybe 5 other families were around us. No rentals, there are bathrooms and a gorgeous view. The best part is that your 5 minutes from Carmelis goat cheese, for some delicious, locally made gelato.
It's a wonderful place to go to. It's out of the way. But it's very quiet and peaceful. I love going there just to relax and listen to the creek that runs through the middle of the park 🏞
Sunnyside is an amazing park, I was there for the Coca Cola Classic Disc Golf Tournament. Awesome weekend.
Loved the park with the rolling hills and trees. Had a wonderful firepit and frisbee golf
Nice relaxing place to picnic or just chill and listen to nature.
Nice quiet place to camp without the noise. Secluded and safe
Nice playground equipment, lots of shade trees, not much traffic. Nice place to have a picnic and play.
Love this beach, can go pretty far into the water and it's still shallow. Not the nicest, but a great place to spend the day! Awesome playground for kids too
Not the best beach but definitely better then city park beach. Good place to take the family and grand kids to play in the water, although they still prefer the water slides

This beach was a unique experience for me. There were loads of people around and had very strong winds on a hot summer day and i just layed there in the sand looking out to the mountains. if you were there you would just get this raw feeling, kind of like youre out of this world. It was a rush. Best beach in the okanagan.
Nice people at gyro. Very social and culturally appealing
A spectacular view of the lake.  Great, little park.
Has a long Beautiful trail with a lot of sides routes. A very easy going hike that takes you along the creek. Some sections can get a lot of foot/bike traffic but overall quite enjoyable

Clean and enjoyable. Good parking. Informative signage during spawning season. Many tables for picnics. Park and playground is popular with parents with young children. Good place for drinking your cappuccino while pushing your child on the swing.
Good spot to bring the Grandchildren too. Go for walks alongside the creek and look for fish or titles.

Beautiful park in the middle of the city. We went here at the end of October and were happy to witness the leaf changing color here. There are trails to walk or bike along. The park is popular with family, kids, friends. There are pine hills on the top of the park. We tried to find the look out spot to see the city from above but were not able to find it though. Nevertheless, it was a nice experience and we are sure to come back here again next time.
Really nice trail options got a 2 hour hike with a toddler and old dogs.

A majestic park filled with lovely overhanging trees, awe-inspiring views of the harbor, and a relaxing trail for walking. There are many great spots to relax and read. And of course, you can't miss the iconic pineapple fountain. Just a wonderful time.

This area is the perfect spot to bring your family for outdoor activities. We enjoyed a picnic on the grass overlooking the water and the kids ran around playing chase after. We flew our drone for awhile and got some gorgeous footage. Lots of beautiful scenery and on weekends break dancers and musical  artists can be found performing. Definitely recommend for some family fun.

The fountain is spectacular. It's nice and easy going. Not much else to do but it's not far from downtown. It would be great to have a botanical garden or planetarium at the park that served cocktails, but I'm just dreaming here.

Waterfront Park was the perfect spot to hang out while our family waited for our reservation time at Fleet Landing.  Lots of space for our kids to run and play and for us to rest in the sun.  Had it been warmer, they would have really enjoyed wading in the fountain.  We made sure to get a family picture in front of the pineapple fountain, too.  Be sure to stop here along your family's travels, too!

This is such a great place for a romantic walk on the water. There is a nice pier with picnic tables for a great lunch or early dinner. The famous Pineapple Fountain is here. There are several fountains for kids to run around in during the hot summers. It's a great place to visit and definitely worth taking the time to see.

Although our meal was nice, it was served cold. We had steak and seared tuna with veggies. It was tasty but cold, which would have been okay in the summer, but it was a chilly night and we would have appreciated a hot meal. Also, the bistro was very noisy. It would be good for the restaurant to provide some sound attenuation so conversation is not difficult. All in all, okay, but not great for the price.

Best winery I've ever visited. A variety of their wines win International competitions regularly and at the same time, most of their wine is also organic.

Features free tastings and a nice restaurant with a great view.

I'm hoping they will get specialized glasses for the different varietals in the near future.

wines organic and well made, not a wine drinker but they are still fantastic to bring friends in and try or take some home as well!

take home meals are a great experience. taste of mexico was phenomenal for the amount of food/price! would get again.
This is in the top 5 wine tours as far as I am concerned! The view is amazing. The pyramid is so unique. You simply must check it out:)

I LOVE this winery and all it does in our community. Stephen, you are a blessing to many for all you do and, of course, the excellent wine and never disappointing venue. Proud to bring my visiting family here. 🙏

Great place for breakfast/brunch. We went at 9am on a sunday and did not have to wait in line, but it quickly became busy and there was a line. The corned hash was very good. They also have a very nice homemade jam. The jam reminded me of the flavor of a strawberry sundae. Staff was friendly and nice too.

Anybody posting a 1 Star review on this place needs to seek professional help. There's a reason this place can take a while to be seated.
Great atmosphere. Better food.

Came for breakfast, turned out to be slow and not very busy. Fairly expensive for simple breakfast food but it is a downtown restaurant with a reputation. Unable to fulfill on this day. Servers were excellent. Bathrooms are clean. Interior decoration interesting. Overall, room for improvement.

We visit the Kelowna area often and twice now we have been to this cafe. Both times the food was incredible with quality ingredients and the staff were friendly and efficient. The Turmeric lattes are amazing too!

We went here for brunch on Sunday. It was really busy but luckily they had a table for two right away. We saw the table right next to us had the pancake and it looked so good we decided to order two of them ($16.5 each). Oh wow it was so delicious. It’s called oatmeal pancake and it has fruit topping. The portion was huge. We also ordered coffee and tea and they were also good too. We will come back again for sure.

Had the chicken curry and made it XL. Curry was quite good the XL size made for a good portion. You basically get a full bowl of curry and separate order of rice instead of them being in the same bowl. Service was very friendly and quick. Great place to pick up lunch on the go. Would definitely go back to try other dishes.

Very popular Downtown eatery. Its small but always bustling. Delicious laksa soup and veggie curry rice bowl. The only time I will ever eat tofu, its that good! I am excited to try more things on the menu.

The Mad Mango Cafe is a great place to have a quick meal with a friend or loved one.
It has a close personal dinning atmosphere.
With GREAT! quality food

I pretty much only go for the Laksa. It's a good price for the portion. I also like the sticky rice and the mango smoothie.  And used to go for the cheap breakfast years ago. Pat has never forgotten my name, even after some time of not eating there. She's super friendly!

The perfect place for a cold day. Go for the Laksa soup. It is outstanding. Delicious. Superb. Fantastic. You get the idea. ;) So yeah, highly recommended plus the price is reasonable and the service was quite attentive.
Best Ribs like the reviews say. Fall off the bone. Fun Memphis decorations. Place filled up fast with people. Employees were very friendly and helpful. Huge bourbon selection.

We went in there at 2:30 on Family Day..hardly anyone in the place. Go up to order, the guy tells us " no chicken, no beef ribs and no rib ends. I asked if they were going to get any and the guy said no.My husband wanted to leave but I said just get a 1/2 rack and I'll get jambalaya. We ordered that and 2 beer. $53. Mine comes and the Jambalaya is in a soup bowl, cutlery us dirty as well as plates. I go to eat my salad, most of it is black and slimy so I pass on it. My meal with little bowl, a salad I cant eat and a little quarter piece of cornbread is $18. My husband had quite a bit of ribs but totally tasteless, fried and little bits of sides. Then we are just finishing and one of the other fellows that work there walk over to the table behind us and told them " yes we have chicken and rib ends, it will be about 10 min" ??!! No, we wont be back..ever.  The health dept needs to check in on that place.
Loved the food here! Fall off the bone ribs. Best BBQ! They have a great location lots to do after. Food is very tastful. I recommend this place if your coming to visit,

Staff is quick and attentive. Pulled pork sandwich is very mediocre -- feels overly pulled with a little too much moisture, resulting in a sloppier texture than I like. Not enough chew to it. Could use more slaw. BBQ sauce flavor is just okay. Prices are fair. Ribs are really tasty. Come with a dry rub and BBQ sauce on the side which I like. Huge portion. Nice atmosphere.
Great laid back atmosphere.  Barbecue very nice but ask for extra sauce if.you get the pulled pork barbecue.

What a lovely experience!  Our food was delicious, our waiter was friendly,  attentive and very knowledgeable. We had great entertainment on the patio, the music was just perfect for the setting. It was an awesome way to end a great Canada Day!

Absolutely loved this place! My wife and I went on a "Groupon date", so among our various stops throughout the day we found this cute little Victorian restaurant.
The food was amazing, fresh, delicious, and great portions. They had live music the night we went which really added to the atmosphere.

If you're looking for an intimate place for a date night, I recommend this place!
The guy was creepy and gave themselves their own tips even though service was awful. Food took forever to come out and didn't know the difference between gluten and vegan. Disappointed.

Excellent service, excellent food, excellent music... We spent our first year anniversary at The Yellow House Restaurant and we couldn't be happier. We chatted with the owners during and after our dinner and they are awesome people. You won't be disappointed by this establishment!

I've come to this location many times over the years.  I've brought family and friends to this location and everyone loves it.  The food is amazing, service is great, often they will have live music.  Price is a bit high but completely worth it.  Great dating spot if you want to impress.

I just had one of their croissants, and honestly I didn't know a croissant could be so enjoyable! The flavour was great, of course, but what surprised me was the lovely texture it had. Outstanding! 5 STARS
Have always loved this place. The chef's suggestions are usually good. Their mussels are the best: plump and juicy and tender. The wine sauce is excellent. Friendly and family-owned.

I was so pleasantly surprised by all of the appetizers and mains our table of 4 had. Authentic traditional French dishes done well and with a lovely selection of old world wines (so hard to come by in the area since most restaurants commit to local winery options from the Okanagan). The only thing that holds me back from 5 stars was desert. The sorbet stuffed profiteroles were disappointing. They weren’t the moist tender center I’m used too and frankly sorbet just doesn’t cut it, a creamy center of pastry cream is simply a lot better.

My Girlfriend andI were both impressed. Bouchons Bistro was an amazing experience from the start. The manager offered us coat check, which was great considering it is currently winter (big coats). Our server knew the menu inside and out, very helpful. Each staff member we interacted with was professional, and personable. The food was beyond expectations, which were already high to begin with. The prices were fair, and the portions were more than one could ask for. The desert finished the night perfectly. We have already booked our next reservation. I'd highly recommend trying Bouchons Bistro for your next date night.

We went here for our 20th anniversary and we were not disappointed. The service was exceptional! I mean exceptional! Our food was delicious and our bubbly was a welcome treat! ...on a side note I had left my phone in the bathroom and they went to great lengths to make sure I got it back. 

Merci Bouchons.
